<h3 class="heading A-TYP22L-RW-ALL remove-bottom-space" id="pp_main_heading_9">
    Eligibility
</h3>
</div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="pp_main_richtext_7" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"></p><p>To apply for our Ultra Wealth Goal Insurance, you'll need to meet both of these requirements:</p>
<div class="commonMark-list">
<ul role="list">
<li>the insured person is aged<sup><a href="#fn-birthdaydefinition" data-back-link-connected=""><span aria-hidden="true">2</span><span class="visuallyhidden">Footnote link 2</span></a></sup> between 15 days after birth and 70 years</li>
<li>meet our criteria for nationality (country/region/territory), address and residency – which are subject to change from time to time</li>
</ul>
</div>
<p></p> 
<p class="A-PAR14R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR14R-RW-ALL">The HSBC Ultra Wealth Goal Insurance Plan is a whole life insurance plan with a savings element underwritten by HSBC Life (International) Limited (“HSBC Life”). It is not equivalent or similar to a bank deposit. Policyholders are subject to HSBC Life's credit risk and early surrender loss.</p>
</div></div>

<div id="pp_main_columnControl_11">

            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="pp_main_richtext_9" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">These additional benefits will be included in the policy at no extra cost.</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li><strong>Additional lump sum payout for accidental death<sup><a href="#fn-additionalaccidentaldeathbenefit3" data-back-link-connected=""><span aria-hidden="true">7</span><span class="visuallyhidden">Footnote link 7</span></a></sup></strong><br> If the insured person passes away in an accident before the policy term ends or they reach age 80<sup><a href="#fn-birthdaydefinition" data-back-link-connected=""><span aria-hidden="true">2</span><span class="visuallyhidden">Footnote link 2</span></a></sup>, whichever is earlier, the beneficiaries will get an extra 30% of the total basic plan premium paid<sup><a href="#fn-insurance-totalbasicplanpremium6" data-back-link-connected=""><span aria-hidden="true">8</span><span class="visuallyhidden">Footnote link 8</span></a></sup> on top of the death benefit payable as an additional accidental death benefit<sup><a href="#fn-additionalaccidentaldeathbenefit3" data-back-link-connected=""><span aria-hidden="true">7</span><span class="visuallyhidden">Footnote link 7</span></a></sup>.</li> 
</ul>
</div></div>

            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="pp_main_richtext_10" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">This plan offers two death benefit settlement options. The beneficiaries listed will receive the death benefit as either:<br> </p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>a lump sum payment</li> 
 <li>regular annual instalments (applicable to policies without any assignments only)</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The policyholder can choose their preferred option when they apply for the policy or after the policy has been issued.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Please refer to product brochure for more details.</p>

            <div class="footnote"><div id="pp_rel_footnote_1" class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV O-FOOTNOTES-RW-DEV" data-refs-visually-hidden="Footnote link" data-footnotes-json-path="/content/hsbc/hk/en_hk.dpws-footnotes.json" role="region">
    <div class="article-separator"> </div>
    
    <div class="row white">
        <div class="m-xsm-12 m-mdsm-10 m-md-8">
            
                <div class="footnote-title">
    
    
    














<h2 class="A-BBST28R-RW-ALL text-container text ">
    
    
        
        Notes
    
</h2>

</div>
            
            
            <ol class="A-TYPS6R-RW-DEV footnotes-list without-bottom-padding"><li><div id="fn-earlyyears" tabindex="-1">You can enjoy financial flexibility by securing guaranteed cash value equal to 85% of premium paid during the first 14 policy years. The guaranteed cash value will then continue to increase gradually throughout the rest of the policy term. </div></li><li><div id="fn-birthdaydefinition" tabindex="-1">The age refers to the age the insured person or policyholder, whichever is applicable, will be on their next birthday. </div></li><li><div id="fn-policyvaluemanagement" tabindex="-1"><p>After the 20th policy year, if there are no outstanding policy loan or premiums, you may apply to exercise the option of locking in a portion of the net cash value.</p>
<p>The amount you choose to lock in is guaranteed upon exercising the Policy Value Management Option and will be allocated to the Policy Value Management balance to accumulate at a non-guaranteed interest rate, which will be adjusted from time to time at our discretion. The exercise of the Policy Value Management Option is subject to the minimum amount requirements on both the: <br>
1. net cash value to be allocated per transaction  <br>
2. policy amount after the exercise of this option  <br>
These minimum amount requirements are determined by us from time to time without prior notice to you. Please refer to product brochure for details.</p>
 </div></li><li><div id="fn-changeoflifeinsured" tabindex="-1">Each policyholder is entitled to the change of life insured of Policy for unlimited times after the first policy year or after the end of the premium payment period provided all premiums are fully paid when due, whichever is later. Change of life insured is subject
to evidence of insurability and approval by HSBC Life which is based on the underwriting conditions of the life insured. Any such request will be assessed on case-by-case basis and is at our discretion, with consideration of multiple factors, including but not limited to the change in underlying claim risk, change in policy term, latest economic outlook; and is at our discretion. </div></li><li><div id="fn-policysplitoption" tabindex="-1">This plan gives you the option to split your policy into up to three new policies ("split policies")
from the 5th policy anniversary. Each of the split policies can further split into maximum of other three split policies. The policy amount of any split policies must not be less than such minimum amount requirement as may be determined by HSBC Life from time to time. There is no indebtedness under any original policy before policy split and such original policy is not under assignment. Any such request will be assessed on case-by-case basis and is at our discretion subject to the terms of the policy. Your policy will be terminated if the request to split policy is approved by us. Please refer to product brochure for details. </div></li><li><div id="fn-contingentpolicyholder" tabindex="-1">Policyholder can designate a contingent policyholder at any time for his/her juvenile policy (not applicable to policies with life insured who has attained the age<sup><a href="#fn-birthdaydefinition" data-back-link-connected=""><span aria-hidden="true">2</span><span class="visuallyhidden">Footnote link 2</span></a></sup> of 18). The option of contingent policyholder is available for the policy without any assignment. </div></li><li><div id="fn-additionalaccidentaldeathbenefit3" tabindex="-1">The additional accidental death benefit will terminate when the insured person reaches the age<sup><a href="#fn-birthdaydefinition" data-back-link-connected=""><span aria-hidden="true">2</span><span class="visuallyhidden">Footnote link 2</span></a></sup>  of 80 or upon the payout of this benefit or when the policy is terminated (whichever is earlier), subject to a maximum benefit limit of USD3,000,000 or its equivalent per insured person across all additional accidental death benefit issued by HSBC Life. Please refer to the policy provisions of the supplementary benefits for detailed terms and conditions of coverage and exceptions. </div></li><li><div id="fn-insurance-totalbasicplanpremium6" tabindex="-1">The total premiums paid refers to the single premium paid under your basic plan—whether or not actually paid—as of the date of death for the insured person. Please refer to the policy provisions for detailed terms and conditions. </div></li></ol>
        </div>
    </div>
</div>

    <p class="A-PAR14R-RW-ALL">HSBC Ultra Wealth Goal Insurance Plan is a whole life insurance plan with a savings element underwritten by HSBC Life (International) Limited (“HSBC Life”) which is authorised and regulated by the Insurance Authority ("IA") to carry on long-term insurance business in the Hong Kong SAR. It is not a bank deposit or bank savings plan. Please refer to the product brochure for detailed features and the policy provisions for the detailed terms and conditions.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR14R-RW-ALL">HSBC Life is incorporated in Bermuda with limited liability, and is one of the HSBC Group's insurance underwriting subsidiaries. The Hongkong and Shanghai Banking Corporation Limited ('HSBC') is registered in accordance with the Insurance Ordinance (Cap. 41 of the Laws of Hong Kong) as an agency of HSBC Life for the distribution of life insurance products in the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region. This product is a product of HSBC Life but not HSBC and it is intended only for sale through HSBC in the Hong Kong SAR.  If the policyholder discontinues and / or surrenders the insurance plan in the early policy years, the amount of the benefit he / she will get back may be considerably less than the amount of the premium he / she has paid. Your benefit is subject to the credit risk of HSBC Life. Your premiums paid will form part of HSBC Life's assets. You do not have any rights or ownership over any of those assets. Your recourse is against HSBC Life only.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR14R-RW-ALL">In respect of an eligible dispute (as defined in the Terms of Reference for the Financial Dispute Resolution Centre in relation to the Financial Dispute Resolution Scheme) arising between HSBC and you out of the selling process or processing of the related transaction, HSBC is required to enter into a Financial Dispute Resolution Scheme process with you; however, any dispute over the contractual terms of the above insurance product should be resolved between HSBC Life and you directly.</p>
